title: Mild Rush, No Appetite, Difficulty Sleeping
author: plasmatika
citation: plasmatika. "Mild Rush, No Appetite, Difficulty Sleeping: experience with 4-Fluoroamphetamine (ID 76163)". Erowid.org. Feb 16, 2009. erowid.org/exp/76163
report:
I have taken Neo Doves in pill format, Mephedrone and Methylene previously - but this was my first go at 4-FMP/4FA.

The plastic envelope for 1g of this compound reads:

4-FMP/4-FA

1-(4-Fluorophenyl)propan-2-amine Purity:98.2+%

I inhaled a very thin line [50 mg approx.] as this was my first time and the pain was excruciating, more so than any of the others mentioned above  I thought my nose was bleeding! But it wasnt. After a few long seconds the area between my teeth and nose went slightly numb, and then teeth felt a bit sore.

Also, it left a vestige smell of burnt plastic in my nose, which was disconcerting to say the least. We got this from our usual source so I think this is just the natural smell of the compound, but maybe Im wrong? The smell went away quickly.

I only inhaled 50 mg but it was enough to get a mild and pleasant rush of energy. After about 5 minutes, I could feel it moving down my throat and feeling sort of refreshing. I had a runny nose for sometime.

I dont think Id be able to snort much more than a couple of lines  next time I think Ill bomb 100mg, but initial impression is good.

Got slightly anxious after a couple of hours and had absolutely no appetite until the next day (I took it at 16:00)  had some difficulty sleeping too.
